messages.content:
You are an ontology-focused information extractor. Your job is to read source text and produce structured knowledge as subject–predicate–object triples.

Guidelines:
- Always normalise entity wording to the canonical label when synonyms or variants appear. Treat aliases such as "Artificial intelligence", "AI", and "A.I." as the same concept and emit the most common canonical label.
- Predicates must be at most three words and express a clear relation.
- Attributes should be included where contextual information can assist (e.g metrics, conditions, valuations)
- Provide optional "tags" array for the triple when categorical labels (e.g., "safety", "financial") help downstream filtering.
- Only emit facts supported by the provided text. Do not invent information.

- Return valid JSON conforming to this schema:
  {
    "triples": [
      {
        "subject": "<canonical label>",
        "predicate": "<verb or relation>",
        "object": "<canonical label>",
        "subject_type": "<ontology entity type for subject>",
        "object_type": "<ontology entity type for object>",
        "confidence": <0-1 float, optional>,
        "source_reference": "<page/section ref>",
        "suggested_subject_label": "<canonical suggestion>",
        "suggested_object_label": "<canonical suggestion>",
        "subject_attributes": [
          { "name": <attribute name>, "value": <attribute value> }
        ],
        "object_attributes": [
          { "name": <attribute name>, "value": <attribute value> }
        ],
        "tags": ["<label>", ...]
      }
    ]
  }
- When a canonical vocabulary is supplied, prefer the provided labels and use aliases only for matching.
- When abstract entities are present, use common sense to link back to the absolute entity or entities that the source is focused on. E.g. "Less-regulated mine" is not an entity itself, it is a "mine" with lower than normal "regulation" attribute.
- Prefer short subjects and objects, creating new nodes or attaching attributes for supporting information. subjects and objects SHOULD NOT have 'and' or 'from' or 'or' in their label, unless semantically valid in the canonical term. 
- Create a parent subject and use 'is_a' relationships to join subjects if required. 
- Always supply subject_type and object_type when they can be confidently assigned (0.6+ confidence) from context or ontology; otherwise omit the field or leave it null (do NOT guess).
- If no canonical match exists, still emit the best available wording and set the suggested_* fields to your recommended canonical label.
- Return ONLY the JSON, with **NO description** and **NO markdown**. Your reponse should directly be valid JSON.

The following ontology defines valid entities and relationships. If an entity or relationship does not fit, propose an extension flagged as 'for-review'.
Ontology: {"entities":["Component","Country","Failure_Mode","Location","Metal","Mine","Mine_Type","Mineral","Occupation","OEM","Organization","Person","Specification","Technology","Test_Condition","Test_Equipment","Test_Type","TRL","Validation_Method"],"relationships":["developed_by","experiences_failure_mode","extracts","has_component","has_issue","has_mine_type","has_occupation","has_specification","has_trl","have_risk","headquartered_in","investigating","is_a","located_in","operate_in","partnered_with","produce_majority_of","produces","supplies_to","under_test_condition","undergoes_test_type","used_process","uses_technology","uses_test_equipment","validated_by"]}

Ontology entries most relevant to this chunk (JSON). Prioritise these labels for entity typing and predicate selection when evidence supports them.
{"entities":[{"label":"Mine_Type","score":0.30736319489081276},{"label":"Failure_Mode","score":0.280879068704623},{"label":"Mine","score":0.27705660115422326},{"label":"Test_Equipment","score":0.2672295130208001},{"label":"Technology","score":0.2618059870440598},{"label":"TRL","score":0.23156369658410658},{"label":"Mineral","score":0.2161766564610479},{"label":"Specification","score":0.2133576394172594},{"label":"OEM","score":0.21036012866839088},{"label":"Test_Condition","score":0.20683787020712036},{"label":"Location","score":0.19177829782447547},{"label":"Organization","score":0.1863662413198667}],"relationships":[{"label":"has_mine_type","score":0.3643004962597265},{"label":"uses_technology","score":0.2705116545108868},{"label":"uses_test_equipment","score":0.24231493658042486},{"label":"experiences_failure_mode","score":0.23862255563161114},{"label":"under_test_condition","score":0.23457825670383525},{"label":"have_risk","score":0.22985043478712758},{"label":"operate_in","score":0.22967624580706314},{"label":"extracts","score":0.21538415640227432}]}

Condensed document summary carried over from earlier sections:
The document, titled '7d6553c0_Underground Opportunities.pptx', focuses on Copper SA's asset strategy which highlights nine key opportunities with a total un-risked net present value (NPV) of approximately US$10.4 billion. The current section centers on Olympic Dam (OD) Deeps and broader Copper SA (CuSA) mining operations, emphasizing initiatives to improve productivity, reduce costs, and accelerate mining project timelines through automation, innovation, and technology. Significant emphasis is placed on step-change performance by leveraging ore-sorting, block caving, and future concentrator developments across 2030-2040 horizons. Key projects include accelerating OD block caves to reduce brownfield-to-production timelines and improving Oak Dam economics to cut capital costs. The OD Deeps project aims to unlock multi-cave bulk mining with lower operational costs and enable growth via automation and remote mining technologies. Future resource expansion includes sites like Olympic Dam Open Cut, Free Doctor, Khamsin, and Carra Resources. The journey towards OD Deeps is framed as transformational, enabling earlier application of innovative solutions across CuSA's current operations. Overall, the strategy integrates technological advancements and partnerships to realize growth beyond 2040 with a focus on reducing workforce requirements and capital intensity.

Previously identified entities (JSON). Use these labels or aliases when context matches.
{"entity_memory":[{"label":"Block Caving at OD Deeps","aliases":["OD Deeps Block Caving"],"entity_type":"Mining Technology","description":"Mining technology with potential to enable bulk mining and reduce costs via automation and remote mining.","attributes":{"potential_benefits":["bulk mining","lower operational unit cost","step change growth"],"associated_technologies":["automation","remote mining"]}},{"label":"Carra sublevel-caving","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Mining Technology","description":"Sublevel caving method implemented as part of current CuSA mining operations.","attributes":{"associated_with":"CuSA mining operations"}},{"label":"Copper SA Asset Strategy","aliases":["CuSA Strategy"],"entity_type":"Organization Strategy","description":"Asset strategy focusing on nine growth and innovation opportunities in Copper SA mining assets.","attributes":{"total_unrisked_NPV_USD":10.4,"currency":"USD","focus_areas":"Automation, innovation, step-change performance, cost reduction"}},{"label":"CuSA Future Concentrators","aliases":["Future Concentrator Projects"],"entity_type":"Mining Facility","description":"Future concentrator projects aimed at improving capital cost management and operational performance.","attributes":{"timeline":"2030-2035","type":"Concentrator"}},{"label":"Disruptive Systems","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Technology","description":"Systems designed to reduce workforce requirements while unlocking future resources beyond 2035.","attributes":{"workforce_reduction":true,"deployment_horizon":"2040+"}},{"label":"Future Resource Unlock","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Resource Expansion","description":"Future resource projects including Olympic Dam Open Cut, Free Doctor, Khamsin, and Carra Resources.","attributes":{"sites_included":["Olympic Dam Open Cut","Free Doctor","Khamsin","Carra Resources"]}},{"label":"Oak Dam Economics & Optionality","aliases":["Improve Oak Dam economics & optionality"],"entity_type":"Asset Optimization","description":"Initiative to improve economic performance and optionality by reducing capital costs in mining operations.","attributes":{"capital_cost_reduction":true,"timeline":"< 2 years"}},{"label":"OD block caves","aliases":["Accelerate OD block caves"],"entity_type":"Mine Technology","description":"Block cave mining technology aimed at reducing brownfield to production timeline and risk appetite.","attributes":{"timeline_reduction":"< 2 years","deployment_horizon":"2030-2035"}},{"label":"Olympic Dam Deeps","aliases":["OD Deeps"],"entity_type":"Mine","description":"Mining project targeting multi-cave development and bulk mining expansion with automation and reduced costs.","attributes":{"development_horizon":"2035-2040","focus":"Talent, trusted partnerships, growth beyond stage 2 smelter"}},{"label":"Ore-sorting/segregation","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Technology","description":"Technology to increase copper head grade and reduce capital intensity in concentrators.","attributes":{"impact":"Increases Cu head grade, reduces capital costs"}},{"label":"Place Recovery","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Technology","description":"Recovery technology supporting several mining sites including Olympic Dam Open Cut and OD Deeps.","attributes":{"supported_sites":["Olympic Dam Open Cut","OD Deeps","Free Doctor","Khamsin","Carra Resources"]}},{"label":"Upcoming block caving","aliases":[],"entity_type":"Mining Technology","description":"Block caving technology planned to be implemented in CuSA mining operations.","attributes":{"associated_with":"CuSA mining operations"}}]}
Extract knowledge triples from the following text. Limit predicates to three words. Return JSON with triples array.

OD Deeps– Why are those a Problem? 4 Likely Causes: Conventional Block Caving mine layouts won’t work (crushing pillars, squeezing drives, compromised recovery). Undercutting will be more challenging & have potential to fail prior stablishing the cave. Conventional ventilation and cooling systems won’t work. Use of conventional mining equipment won’t work. UG equipment automated with conventional built components won’t work. Conventional ways of maintaining and servicing automated fleet. Conventional explosives won’t work. Conventional shotcrete won’t work. Conventional monitoring systems won’t work. Use of conventional infrastructure won’t work (Electrical Subs, Comms, Pumping Systems, etc). Failure to maintain pumping system operating efficiently. Current Refuge Chambers technology won’t work. Current methodology for Emergency Response won’t work. Current PPE won’t be fit for purpose. Root Cause: How to develop, construct and maintain a deep remoted/automated block cave mine to support high productivity is within the unknown on current mine layout designs, techs, resources, processes and systems? CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION – NOT TO BE SHARED WITHOUT TAD MINING APPROVAL Not viable for humans? How long can people stay underground? Hazardous environment from Radon exposure and respirable atmosphere. Not viable for humans? How long can people stay underground? People safety: heat stroke exhaustion, burns from hot water. Poor morale and reduced productivity. High temps = reduced awareness and an increase in safety incidents (potentially). Emergency response times. Corrosion will affect ground support. Stronger support material need. GS cost increase. Explosives failure. Cost increase. Equipment reliability because of built material used. $$$ Resins and shotcrete unknown performance vs hot rock. High rehab cost. Possible impact in concrete and shotcrete quality. Additional geotechnical assurances to structural cost. Steel sets. Hard to maintain equipment at broken or service location. Machine cannot be removed High temp in equipment impacts EV, tyres, RC aircon, hydraulics. High temp – electronic component failure. Unknown equipment reliability. Unknown Refuge Chambers reliability. Higher exposure risks for explosives equipment, agitators, shotcreters, etc. Comms compromised. Uncertainty and variability. All type of monitoring systems and sensor are compromised BC monitoring systems with batteries don’t work at high temp Calibration, validation, data sharing, real time tracking. Calibration, validation, data sharing, real time tracking. Calibration, validation, data sharing, real time tracking. Mine design needs to change. Material Handling Systems complexity and cost at depth Larger Ventilation and cooling systems, its complexity and cost at depth. Mine regulations. Radon More rigorous and lengthier development and underground construction processes Drill and Blast challenges/ performance at higher temperature and deeper ground, higher stresses. Continuous mining challenges/ performance at higher temperature and deeper ground, higher stresses. Size of surface impact. Production is king – a paradigm shift. Regulations. Restrictions How to keep people safe. Can we evacuate in those conditions Increased time for re-entry. Increased Exclusion times. Rock burst, induced seismicity. Stable tunnels vs Equipment size and capacity Unlearn what we know: high recovery needs small pillars in block caving. Olympic Dam (OD) Deeps Challenging Conditions? 5 Critical Conditions Other Conditions CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION – NOT TO BE SHARED WITHOUT TAD MINING APPROVAL
